alert.note: Alert for Clarendon; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 9:42PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Clarendon and central Sumter Counties through 1030 PM EDT... At 941 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sumter, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. Heavy rainfall that will lead to ponding of water on roadways and minor flooding of low lying areas. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sumter, South Sumter, Mulberry, Alcolu, Sumter County Airport, Millwood, Turbeville, Cane Savannah, Brogdon, Lakewood, Privateer, East Sumter, Gable, Oswego, Wedgewood, and Shiloh. This includes Interstate 95 between mile markers 121 and 137. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
